main event: A bright object, about the brightness of a first magnitude star, was observed in the sky over the Pacific Ocean on March 16, 1964.
interesting points: The object was spotted at an elevation of 70 degrees, flying eastward at a very fast speed.
The observation was made by military personnel and reported via a CIRVIS (Communications Instructions for Reporting Vital Intelligence Sightings) report.
The object's movement and speed were considered consistent with a possible satellite, but the ECHO satellite schedules were not available to confirm this.
The sighting was reported to various military and intelligence agencies, including the Air Force, NORAD, CINCPAC, and the CIA.
No photographs of the object were included in the report.
sighted object: a bright object, about the brightness of a first magnitude star
